result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott M Bennett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under The Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine of $1,000.00 including all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharges to be paid from bail on deposit and balance by 06-21-2016 or serve 25 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work. Court STAYED the commencement until 12-28-2015.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety By Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under The Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott M Bennett

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Scott M Bennett in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion for petition for return of property , the gun ,  is Denied by the Court. All parties in receipt of the order indicating the denial.
Return of property hearing on May 26, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott M Bennett in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 30 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work. Court stayed the commencment until 12-28-15.

Fine of $1000.00 including  all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges  to be paid from bail on deposit and balance by 6-21-16 or serve 25 consecutive days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Defense motion to modify bail argued and granted by the Court. Conditions : may not possess a handgun, but can posses a long barrel only during deer hunting season.

Defendant Scott M Bennett in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott M Bennett in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The court lifts the condition of bail on the ban of weapons for the weekend of 11/21/15 and 11/22/15  only so the defendant can go deer hunting  and possess a rifle on those two days.

Defendant Scott M Bennett in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's appearance waived for purposes of today's hearing.   Parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be reassigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.    Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Ackerman Havas. Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Siefert, Br. 47.  Status conference scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Request for Substitution of Judge.

Defendant Scott M Bennett in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requested a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 23. All parties are notified that effective September 14, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Michelle Ackerman Havas, Branch 45, in Room 515 of the Courthouse due to the rotation of Judge Grady in Branch 23.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott M Bennett in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests case be set for status conference. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form.   Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Status conference scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The remaining bail is to be returned to the remitter.   T
he Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.   
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Defendant has lower number case(s) pending.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Reserve Judge. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07-13-2015 at 01:30pm
